name: Hpd-violations-data
tagline: Scraping, parsing, and hosting HPD violations data in a way that is more accessible to organizers / data folks.
body:
### HPD Violations Data
The [HPD Violations Data](http://www1.nyc.gov/site/hpd/about/violation-open-data.page) is publicly available but only in txt and xml files. This is an attempt to make that data more accessible by scraping and parsing it into csv files (which can be opened and edited in Microsoft Excel). 

The [HPD Violations Data](http://www1.nyc.gov/site/hpd/about/violation-open-data.page) is publicly available but only in txt and xml files. This is an attempt to make that data more accessible by scraping and parsing it into csv files (which can be opened and edited in Microsoft Excel). 

The [HPD Violations Data](http://www1.nyc.gov/site/hpd/about/violation-open-data.page) is publicly available but only in txt and xml files. This is an attempt to make that data more accessible by scraping and parsing it into csv files (which can be opened and edited in Microsoft Excel). 

The [HPD Violations Data](http://www1.nyc.gov/site/hpd/about/violation-open-data.page) is publicly available but only in txt and xml files. This is an attempt to make that data more accessible by scraping and parsing it into csv files (which can be opened and edited in Microsoft Excel). 

* [BLAH](data/Violation20130228.csv)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
